metadata.description:
This data set contains data of meteorological elements observation system of farmland station downstream of heihe hydrometeorological observation network from January 1, 2014 to December 31, 2014.The station is located at sidao bridge, dalai hubu town, ejin banner, Inner Mongolia.The latitude and longitude of the observation point are 101.1338e, 42.0048n, and 875m above sea level.The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;The two infrared thermometer sensors are installed at the position of 6m, facing south, and the probe is facing vertically downward.The two photosynthetic radiometers are installed at the position of 6m, facing due south, and the probes are vertically up and down in one direction.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface, 2cm and 4cm underground, and 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil moisture sensor (installed on March 15, 2014) was buried 2cm and 4cm underground, in the south due to 2m from the meteorological tower.The soil hot flow plates (3) are successively buried in the ground 6cm away from the weather tower 2m due south.
Radiation observation projects are: four components (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit: c), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts per square meter), soil temperature (Ts_0cm Ts_2cm Ts_4cm) (unit: c), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm) (unit:Volume water content, percentage), up and down photosynthetic effective radiation (PAR_up, PAR_down) (unit: micromole/m s).
Processing and quality control of observation data :(1) ensure 144 data per day (every 10min). If data is missing, it will be marked by -6999;Due to site reconstruction, data was missing between April 15, 2014 and July, 2014;(2) eliminate the moments with duplicate records;(3) data that is obviously beyond the physical meaning or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked by red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) the format of date and time is uniform, and the date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2014-9-10-10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
Please refer to Li et al.(2013) for hydrometeorological network or site information, and Liu et al.(2011) for observation data processing.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2014年1月1日至2014年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网下游农田站气象要素观测系统数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗达来呼布镇四道桥，下垫面是甜瓜农田。观测点的经纬度是101.1338E, 42.0048N，海拔875m。四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计传感器安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；两个光合有效辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm处，并距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器（2014.3.15安装）分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，并距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、向上和向下光合有效辐射（PAR_up、PAR_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；由于站点重建，在2014.4.15-6.7之间数据缺失；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2014-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法通过操作性卫星和地面数据轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡动协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间的关系更为复杂。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而变得主导。在这封信中，显示出与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及在离地面4.5米处使用10 Hz采样频率的涡度相关系统测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig–Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些数据是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中获得的，该实验针对异质土地表面，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在农业景观中捕捉土壤和冠层温度的数据收集方法的特点是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: thermal infrared camera, thermal images every 120 minutes, 25-m-high platform, boundary layer tower, soil and canopy component temperatures, maximum-likelihood method, thermal infrared temperatures converted to radiation temperatures using incoming long-wave radiation and emissivities
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 热红外相机，每120分钟拍摄一次热图像，25米高的平台，边界层塔，土壤和冠层组分温度，最大似然法，使用入射长波辐射和发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What specific attributes are observed in the hydrometeorological data collection of oasis-desert systems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统的水文气象数据收集中观察到哪些具体属性？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, soil moisture profiles, groundwater table data

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'eddy covariance system' in the context of data collection for energy, water vapor, and carbon flux measurements?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在能量、水汽和碳通量测量的数据收集中，“涡度协方差系统”指的是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: An eddy covariance system is a method used for measuring and calculating vertical turbulent fluxes within the earth's atmosphere. It involves the use of high-frequency (10 Hz) observations of wind speed, temperature, and other scalars to directly measure the exchange of gases, such as carbon dioxide, between the surface and the atmosphere.
Definition.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统是一种用于测量和计算地球大气中垂直湍流通量的方法。它涉及使用高频（10 Hz）观测风速、温度和其他标量，以直接测量气体（如二氧化碳）在表面与大气之间的交换。

Definition.QuestionEn: How is the 'stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique' employed to validate evapotranspiration estimates in hydrological studies?
Definition.QuestionCn: “稳定氧和氢同位素技术”是如何在水文研究中用于验证蒸散发估算的？
Definition.AnswerEn: The stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique is used to validate evapotranspiration estimates by analyzing the isotopic ratios of water vapor, which can provide insights into the sources and processes of water vapor formation. This method helps in distinguishing between evaporation and transpiration components in evapotranspiration studies, enhancing the accuracy of hydrological models.
Definition.AnswerCn: 稳定氧和氢同位素技术用于通过分析水蒸气的同位素比率来验证蒸散发估算，这可以提供水蒸气形成的来源和过程的见解。这种方法有助于区分蒸发和蒸腾成分，从而提高水文模型的准确性。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do data collection techniques using the eddy covariance system compare with those using automatic weather stations in terms of measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用涡度协方差系统的数据收集技术与使用自动气象站在测量能量、水蒸气和碳通量方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The eddy covariance system provides half-hourly turbulent flux data, which is useful for detailed analysis of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes. In contrast, automatic weather stations collect hydrometeorological data with a 10-minute averaging period, including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles, making them suitable for capturing broader meteorological conditions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统提供半小时的湍流通量数据，这对于详细分析能量、水蒸气和碳通量非常有用。相比之下，自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期收集水文气象数据，包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面，使其适合捕捉更广泛的气象条件。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors lead to the challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas using remote sensing data?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业地区，使用遥感数据准确估计表面通量面临的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging due to the uncertainty in surface–air temperature differences, which are dominant due to errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. Additionally, the strong advective environment can further complicate the estimation process.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是具有挑战性的，因为表面与空气温度差异的不确定性占主导地位，这主要是由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差。此外，强对流环境进一步复杂化了估计过程。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems in arid and semiarid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在干旱和半干旱地区保持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: It is critical to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems to achieve sustainable oasis development, as these areas support a significant portion of the population and play an essential role in the ecological and economic stability of arid regions. Oases also significantly affect the carbon balance, making them important for both regional ecological security and global carbon cycle dynamics.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在实现可持续绿洲发展的过程中，保持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要，因为这些地区支持着相当一部分人口，并在干旱地区的生态和经济稳定中发挥着重要作用。绿洲还对碳平衡产生显著影响，使其在区域生态安全和全球碳循环动态中都显得尤为重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes data collection and classification errors when using thermal infrared cameras for estimating evapotranspiration in agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在农业地区使用热红外相机估算蒸散发时，导致数据收集和分类错误的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Data collection and classification errors when using thermal infrared cameras are primarily caused by image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance. These errors can lead to overestimation of canopy temperature and uncertainty in the estimated temperatures due to misclassification of soil and vegetation pixels. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance can contribute to uncertainties.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 使用热红外相机进行数据收集和分类时，主要由图像分类错误引起的错误与植被丰度有关。这些错误可能导致对树冠温度的高估，以及由于土壤和植被像素的误分类而导致的温度估计不确定性。此外，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率也会导致不确定性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary objective of creating a dataset that includes energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas using long-term observational data?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 创建一个包含绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测的长期观测数据集的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objective is to achieve a quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, which is crucial for recognizing the oasis–desert interactions and is significant for protecting the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases. This understanding supports the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis and contributes to achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是实现对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义。这种理解支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展，并有助于实现碳达峰和碳中和的目标。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the goals of implementing a comprehensive data collection network encompassing hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters in arid regions' oasis–desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区绿洲-沙漠系统中实施全面的数据收集网络，涵盖水文气象、植被和土壤参数的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goals include understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in these ecosystems, maintaining the ecological balance between oasis and desert systems, and supporting sustainable oasis development. This comprehensive data collection is crucial for addressing ecological challenges such as land desertification and for enhancing the carbon balance understanding in arid regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标包括了解这些生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的基本特征，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的生态平衡，并支持可持续的绿洲发展。这一全面的数据收集对于应对生态挑战，如土地沙漠化，以及增强对干旱地区碳平衡的理解至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the specific procedures involved in setting up and maintaining an automatic weather station for collecting hydrometeorological data in an oasis–desert ecosystem?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中建立和维护自动气象站以收集水文气象数据的具体程序是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The procedures involve installing the weather station at a specific site, such as a meteorological tower, and ensuring it is equipped with sensors for measuring various parameters like air temperature, humidity, wind speed and direction, radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature. Data is collected at regular intervals (e.g., every 10 minutes), and the system needs regular maintenance to ensure data accuracy and reliability. Additionally, data processing steps include quality control measures, such as removing duplicate records and handling missing or erroneous data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 这些程序涉及在特定地点（如气象塔）安装气象站，并确保其配备用于测量各种参数的传感器，如空气温度、湿度、风速和风向、辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度。数据以定期间隔（例如每10分钟）收集，系统需要定期维护以确保数据的准确性和可靠性。此外，数据处理步骤包括质量控制措施，例如删除重复记录和处理缺失或错误的数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What is the process for obtaining and utilizing stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope measurements in validating evapotranspiration models in arid agricultural areas?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 获取和利用稳定氧和氢同位素测量值以验证干旱农业地区蒸散发模型的过程是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The process involves collecting water vapor samples from the field, which are then analyzed for their isotopic composition using spectrometry techniques. The isotopic data is used to partition evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration components, which can be compared with model outputs. These measurements provide a means to validate and refine models like the TSEB by offering an independent check on the partitioning of water fluxes in arid agricultural landscapes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该过程涉及从现场收集水蒸气样本，然后使用光谱技术分析其同位素组成。所获得的同位素数据用于将蒸散作用分为蒸发和蒸腾两个部分，并与模型输出进行比较。这些测量提供了一种验证和完善模型（如TSEB）的方法，通过提供对干旱农业景观中水通量分配的独立检查。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions enable the effective use of the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model for estimating evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件能够有效地使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型来估算异质景观中的蒸散发？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The effective use of the TSEB model is enabled by the availability of ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, which can be used to better validate evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration estimates. Additionally, the use of a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to the TSEB model, along with validation using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques and eddy covariance measurements, facilitates accurate estimations.
Enablement.AnswerCn: TSEB模型的有效使用得益于地面测量的土壤和冠层组件温度的可用性，这些温度可以更好地验证蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发的估算。此外，使用高分辨率热像仪作为TSEB模型的输入，并结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度协方差测量进行验证，有助于实现准确的估算。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do long-term observational datasets enable a better understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据集如何促进对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的更好理解？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets, consisting of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, along with auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, provide comprehensive insights into the interactions within oasis-desert ecosystems. These datasets, acquired through methods like eddy covariance systems and automatic weather stations, are critical for achieving sustainable development and ecological stability in these regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集，包括能量、水汽和碳通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据，提供了对绿洲-沙漠生态系统内部相互作用的全面洞察。这些数据集通过涡度协方差系统和自动气象站等方法获取，对于实现这些地区的可持续发展和生态稳定至关重要。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways does the integration of meteorological parameters and advanced imaging techniques enable improved partitioning of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 气象参数与先进成像技术的结合如何促进蒸散发的蒸发和蒸腾的更好划分？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of meteorological parameters, such as air temperature, wind speed, and humidity, with advanced imaging techniques like thermal infrared cameras allows for improved partitioning of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration. This is achieved by accurately calculating soil and canopy component temperatures, which are crucial for applying energy balance equations and validating model outputs against observed data.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 气象参数，如空气温度、风速和湿度，与先进的成像技术如热红外相机的结合，可以更好地将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾。这是通过准确计算土壤和树冠组件的温度来实现的，这对于应用能量平衡方程和将模型输出与观测数据进行验证至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in achieving accurate data collection for soil and vegetation temperatures in arid regions using existing methods?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，使用现有方法进行土壤和植被温度的准确数据收集可能面临挑战的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Existing composite temperature separation approaches have limited effectiveness in arid regions, and errors in derived component temperatures can be caused by image classification errors and atmospheric interference, making it difficult to achieve accurate measurements.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 现有的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限，派生的组分温度可能因图像分类错误和大气干扰而产生误差，这使得实现准确测量变得困难。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to understand the energy and water vapor exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems, and what challenges are faced in collecting this data?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量和水汽交换很重要，收集这些数据面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Understanding energy and water vapor exchange is crucial for maintaining ecological and economic stability in oasis-desert systems. However, challenges include ecological degradation in arid regions, such as drying rivers and desertification, which complicate long-term data collection.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 理解能量和水蒸气交换对于维持绿洲-沙漠系统的生态和经济稳定至关重要。然而，干旱地区的生态退化，如河流干涸和沙漠化，给长期数据收集带来了挑战。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of the data collection methods utilized in capturing hydrometeorological elements in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您将如何评估在捕捉绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的水文气象要素时所采用的数据收集方法的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The data collection methods employed, such as the use of eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic weather stations, appear to be effective in capturing detailed hydrometeorological elements. These methods enable half-hourly data acquisition and involve a comprehensive suite of measurements, including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles, among others. This comprehensive approach is crucial in understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges occurring in oasis–desert ecosystems. However, the effectiveness of these methods also depends on rigorous data processing, quality control, and long-term observation to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 所采用的数据收集方法，如涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站，似乎在捕捉详细的水文气象要素方面非常有效。这些方法能够每半小时获取数据，并涉及一系列全面的测量，包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面等。这种综合方法对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳的交换至关重要。然而，这些方法的有效性也依赖于严格的数据处理、质量控制和长期观测，以确保准确性和可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges faced in separating soil and canopy component temperatures using remote sensing data in strongly advective agricultural areas.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定在强烈的对流农业地区使用遥感数据分离土壤和冠层成分温度时面临的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges in separating soil and canopy component temperatures include errors caused by image classification, which vary with vegetation abundance. Additionally, strong advective conditions can lead to overestimation of canopy temperatures. Ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance might also produce uncertainties in temperature estimates.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 分离土壤和冠层组件温度的挑战包括由于图像分类引起的误差，这些误差随着植被丰度的变化而变化。此外，强烈的平流条件可能导致冠层温度的高估。忽略大气向上辐射和透射率也可能导致温度估计的不确定性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how the data processing and quality control procedures maintain the integrity of datasets collected for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange studies.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解数据处理和质量控制程序如何维护用于能量、水蒸气和碳交换研究收集的数据集的完整性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control procedures involve systematic data collection, processing, and archiving. They ensure the integrity of datasets by adhering to standardized methodologies, including logging data from multiple meteorological stations and using rigorous quality control measures to handle discrepancies and validate data accuracy.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序涉及系统的数据收集、处理和归档。它们通过遵循标准化的方法确保数据集的完整性，包括从多个气象站记录数据，并使用严格的质量控制措施来处理差异和验证数据的准确性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the key data collection methods used for hydrometeorological observations in oasis-desert ecosystems and discuss their effectiveness in capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中用于水文气象观测的主要数据收集方法，并讨论它们在捕捉能量、水蒸气和碳交换方面的有效性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The key data collection methods include using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for acquiring half-hourly turbulent flux data, and automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data with 10-minute average periods. These methods effectively capture energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems by providing long-term datasets that include radiation, soil heat flux, temperature profiles, and other parameters.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 关键的数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取半小时的湍流通量数据，以及使用自动气象站获取10分钟平均的水文气象数据。这些方法通过提供长期数据集，有效捕捉绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换，数据集包括辐射、土壤热通量、温度剖面和其他参数。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the challenges faced in the data collection process for evapotranspiration estimation in heterogeneous landscapes and suggest potential improvements for these methods.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在异质景观中进行蒸散发估算的数据收集过程中面临的挑战，并建议这些方法的潜在改进。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges include the difficulty of composite temperature separation in arid regions and errors caused by image classification, especially in areas with varying vegetation coverage. Methods could be improved by enhancing the accuracy of soil and canopy temperature measurements and reducing classification errors in image processing, thus improving the reliability of evapotranspiration estimates.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 挑战包括在干旱地区复合温度分离的困难以及由于图像分类引起的错误，特别是在植被覆盖变化较大的区域。通过提高土壤和冠层温度测量的准确性以及减少图像处理中的分类错误，可以改善方法，从而提高蒸散发估算的可靠性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please conduct a search for potential datasets that can be used to study oasis-desert interactions, focusing on long-term observational data of energy and carbon fluxes.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请搜索潜在的数据集，以研究绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，重点关注能量和碳通量的长期观测数据。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets for studying oasis-desert interactions include those collected from the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin, where 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established. These datasets cover energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, as well as hydrometeorological data, and are available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 研究绿洲与沙漠相互作用的潜在数据集包括来自黑河流域中下游收集的数据，该地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站。这些数据集涵盖了能量、水汽和碳交换，以及水文气象数据，并可从国家西藏高原数据中心获取。
